author: alexnoel.co
post_text: May 23, 2018 at 11:46â€¯PM#1I'd like to be able to store some user interaction into a variable, along the lines of "SetVar $cmd = @".It seems like the spaces that are coming from the "@" result are making that command invalid, so I need to essentially get the result of the @ command in quotations.Doing SetVar $cmd = "@" doesn't work, and the command line doesn't treat /"  @ /" as if it were escape characters. Is there a way around this?
title: Command line @ interaction with variables
